msgSnippet: I am not an agent of JUnit. What follows is my opinion and nothing more. JUnit is so simple that there is no need for support of any kind, beyond this mailing

From: rainsber@...

I am not an agent of JUnit. What follows is my opinion and nothing more.

JUnit is so simple that there is no need for support of any kind, beyond
this mailing list. I hope that JUnit always stays as simple as it is now,
so that it never needs support.

That's the beauty of JUnit: its simplicity.

J. B. Rainsberger  <rainsber@...>
Commerce Suite Accelerator: Rule Services, IBM Toronto Lab
8200 Warden Av, Office A3-735 [A3/FNB/8200/MKM]
Markham ON   L6G 1C7
905 413-2501 (969-2501)


"Penny Heatherington" <pheatherington@...> on 07/10/2001
17:59:21

Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com

To:   junit@yahoogroups.com
cc:
Subject:  [junit] Support for JUnit



My company has started to use JUnit as a testing tool for our Java
development. We are considering making it an 'organizationally approved'
tool for our development environment.  In order to accomplish this, we will
perform a technical evaluation of the tool and submit an 'to be approved'
recommendation to our Standards Committee. A 'Support Plan' must accompany
the request for approval.  Consequently, I am researching support that is
available for the tool.

Do you have any specific information regarding JUnit support? Have any
articles been written on the subject? Has a "Support Plan" been written by
one of Junit's users.

I have visited the SourceForge site as well as JUnit.org, so I am generally
familiar with what is there.

Does anyone provide telephone support?

Thank you for any information you can provide.

Penny Heatherington
Project Lead
OppenheimerFunds
